alert.note: Alert for St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 3:23AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...St. Charles Parish. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Sidewalks and roads, particularly bridges, overpasses, and lesser traveled secondary roads, may become slippery. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute late tonight and Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mix of rain, light freezing rain and freezing drizzle is currently moving across this area this morning. Precipitation ends from west to east not too long after sunrise this morning, but remaining water on roads freezing icy roads are likely to continue into the morning commute as any remaining water on roads could quickly freezing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
